project.name: Credit Usage Tracking & Admin Menu System

features.name: Credit Usage Tracking & Admin Menu System
features.description: Migrate hardcoded pricing to DB-managed credit_menu. Add rich per-action credit_logs, grace threshold, daily/weekly budget caps, user-facing transparent pricing page, 45-day log retention, and Copilot usage intelligence.

existingInfrastructure.note: DO NOT REBUILD — extend these. See plan-credit-system.json for original build.
tables: credit_transactions (immutable ledger: purchase | deduction | refund | adjustment | bonus)
ai_cost_events (raw per-call cost events, used by existing analytics)
ai_feature_config (feature -> model mapping, intelligence_tier in settings JSONB)
edgeFunctions: get-credit-balance (full balance, packs, burn rate, usage breakdown)
frontendFiles: src/lib/config/creditPacks.ts — ACTION_CREDIT_COSTS (hardcoded costs, will be fallback-only)

stories.title: Create credit_menu, credit_menu_history, and price_snapshots migration
acceptance: credit_menu table with action_id PK, display_name, category, unit, cost_low/medium/high, is_active, free_with_sub, is_flat_rate, menu_version, updated_by
credit_menu_history audit trail with before/after pricing, event_type (created|updated|activated|deactivated)
price_snapshots table with cost_at_queue, tier_at_queue, expires_at (7 days) for queued workflow versioning
Trigger increments menu_version on price or is_active changes
Trigger auto-inserts credit_menu_history row on INSERT and UPDATE
Seeded with all 17 actions from ACTION_CREDIT_COSTS + INTEGRATION_CREDIT_COSTS + agent costs
get_action_credit_cost(action_id, tier) RPC returns live pricing for edge functions
get_credit_menu_for_tier(tier) RPC returns active menu grouped by category
stories.notes: Already written. Migration file created at 20260221040000_credit_menu_table.sql

stories.title: Create credit_logs and credit_log_summaries migration
acceptance: credit_logs table: log_id UUID, user_id, org_id, action_id, display_name, credits_charged DECIMAL, intelligence_tier enum, balance_before, balance_after, context_summary TEXT, context_refs JSONB, source enum (user_initiated|agent_automated|sequence_step|scheduled), agent_type TEXT nullable, created_at, status enum (completed|failed|refunded)
credit_log_summaries table: user_id, org_id, month DATE, category, total_credits DECIMAL, action_count INT — for post-purge analytics
RLS: users read own logs (0-30 days), service_role reads all (0-45 days)
Index on (org_id, user_id, created_at DESC) for fast user queries
Index on (created_at) for efficient purge job
get_user_credit_logs(user_id, days) RPC — returns last N days with 30-day ceiling for non-admins

stories.title: Update costTracking.ts to read pricing from credit_menu DB and write to credit_logs
acceptance: New getActionCostFromDB(client, actionId, tier) async function calls get_action_credit_cost RPC. Falls back to getActionCost() from creditPacks.ts if DB returns null.
logAICostEvent() and logFlatRateCostEvent() now call getActionCostFromDB for pricing lookup
Both functions write a credit_logs entry with full context (source='agent_automated', balance_before/after from deduction result)
context_refs JSONB populated from metadata parameter (meeting_id, contact_id, deal_id etc.)
Backward compatible: all existing call sites work without changes
No change to existing ai_cost_events writes (both tables written)

implementation.getActionCostFromDB: const { data } = await client.rpc('get_action_credit_cost', { p_action_id: actionId, p_tier: tier }); return data ?? getActionCost(actionId, tier);
implementation.credit_logs_write: After deductAndMaybeTopUp, insert into credit_logs with full context. Use supabase admin client (service role) for log write so it doesn't fail on RLS.
implementation.balanceCapture: deduct_credits_fifo returns new balance — that's balance_after. Query org_credit_balance before deduction for balance_before.

stories.title: Create admin-credit-menu edge function (admin CRUD)
acceptance: GET / — list all credit_menu entries (including drafts) with latest history entry
POST / — create new action in draft state (is_active=false). Validates all 3 tier prices are set.
PUT /:action_id — update pricing. Validates no tier is null/zero for active items.
PATCH /:action_id/activate — set is_active=true (draft -> live)
PATCH /:action_id/deactivate — set is_active=false
GET /history — full credit_menu_history audit trail, ordered by changed_at DESC
Auth: platform super-admin only (check user metadata or platform_admins table)
Uses getCorsHeaders(req) from corsHelper.ts

implementation.auth: Verify JWT, check user has platform admin role via service role client
implementation.pattern: Route on method + path. Service role client for all writes. Return JSON with standard envelope: { data, error }.

stories.title: Create get-credit-menu edge function (public, active items)
acceptance: Returns active credit_menu entries grouped by category: { ai_actions: [...], agents: [...], integrations: [...], enrichment: [...], storage: [...] }
Each entry includes: action_id, display_name, description, unit, cost_low, cost_medium, cost_high, free_with_sub, is_flat_rate
Optional ?tier=low|medium|high query param — if provided, also returns resolved_cost for the tier
Auth: any authenticated user (JWT required)
Cached: 5 minute cache header so UI doesn't hammer DB on every page load

stories.title: Add grace threshold support and negative balance to deduct_credits_fifo
acceptance: org_credit_balance gains grace_threshold_credits DECIMAL column (default 10 for self-serve, configurable per org)
deduct_credits_fifo() updated: if balance < cost but balance > -grace_threshold, allow and go negative
If balance <= -grace_threshold, return -1 (blocked) as before
checkCreditBalance() in costTracking.ts updated to return grace zone status: { allowed, balance, inGrace: boolean }
When entering grace zone, insert a credit_log entry with source='grace_threshold' for audit trail
On next top-up (add_credits_pack or add_credits), if balance is negative, settle the negative first

implementation.deductLogic: In deduct_credits_fifo: IF new_balance < -grace_threshold THEN RETURN -1 (blocked). ELSE allow deduction even if new_balance < 0.
implementation.settleOnTopup: In add_credits_pack/add_credits: if org_credit_balance.balance_credits < 0 before add, note recovery in credit_transactions with type='grace_recovery'.

stories.title: Create credit_budget_caps migration (daily/weekly per-org caps)
acceptance: credit_budget_caps table: org_id (PK), cap_type enum (daily|weekly|unlimited), cap_amount DECIMAL nullable, current_period_spent DECIMAL default 0, period_reset_at TIMESTAMPTZ
RLS: org admins read/write own org caps
reset_budget_period() function: sets current_period_spent=0, period_reset_at=next reset time (midnight for daily, next Monday for weekly)
pg_cron job entry to call reset_budget_period() daily at 00:01 UTC for daily caps and Monday 00:01 for weekly caps
check_budget_cap(org_id) RPC returns { allowed, spent, cap, cap_type, resets_at }

stories.title: Wire budget cap check into costTracking.ts
acceptance: New checkBudgetCap(client, orgId) function in costTracking.ts calls check_budget_cap RPC
Returns { allowed, spent, cap, capType, resetsAt }
logAICostEvent() and logFlatRateCostEvent() call checkBudgetCap before deduction. If not allowed, return early without charging (log failed status to credit_logs).
increment_budget_spent(orgId, amount) called after successful deduction to update current_period_spent
cap_type='unlimited' always returns allowed=true
Backward compat: if credit_budget_caps row doesn't exist for org, treat as unlimited

stories.title: Build user-facing Credit Menu page component
acceptance: New 'Pricing' tab in CreditsSettingsPage (alongside Top Up, Inventory, Usage, Transactions, Settings)
Fetches from get-credit-menu edge function via creditService.getCreditMenu()
Shows active intelligence tier indicator (Low/Medium/High) with highlight on user's current tier column
Groups actions by category with section headers: AI Actions, Autonomous Agents, Integrations & Enrichment, Storage
FREE badge (green) on free_with_sub actions. Flat-rate badge on is_flat_rate integrations.
Credit pack comparison row at bottom: Signal 100cr/£49, Insight 250cr/£89, Intelligence 500cr/£149 with 'Buy' buttons
Budget cap quick-set inline: Daily / Weekly / Unlimited toggle with amount input

implementation.dataFetch: Add getCreditMenu() to creditService.ts. React Query key: ['credit-menu']. Cache 5 minutes.
implementation.tierHighlight: Read user's intelligence tier from useCreditBalance or org settings. Apply bg-blue-500/10 border-blue-500/20 to active tier column.
implementation.table: Use existing Tailwind table pattern from TransactionLog.tsx. Sticky header row.

stories.title: Build Admin Credit Menu management UI
acceptance: New page at /platform/credit-menu (alongside existing AIModelAdmin, SkillsAdmin)
Table shows all credit_menu entries (including drafts), grouped by category
Each row: action_id, display_name, cost_low/medium/high (inline editable), is_active toggle, last updated
Inline edit: click cell to edit price. Validates >0 for all 3 tiers before save.
Warning modal if price change >50% from current value (anti-error protection)
Activate/Deactivate toggle. Draft badge on inactive items.
History drawer: click action to see credit_menu_history for that action_id
Add New Action button: creates draft with action_id, display_name, category, description, unit, all 3 tier prices

implementation.service: adminCreditMenuService.ts: listAll(), update(actionId, data), create(data), activate(actionId), deactivate(actionId), getHistory(actionId). All call admin-credit-menu edge function.
implementation.inlineEdit: Use contentEditable or small input on focus. Debounce save 800ms.
implementation.routing: Add route to platform admin router. Guard with isPlatformAdmin check.

stories.title: Create log retention purge edge function (45-day, nightly)
acceptance: Edge function purge-credit-logs runs nightly at 03:00 UTC via pg_cron
Before deleting, aggregates to-be-purged entries (>45 days) into credit_log_summaries by (org_id, user_id, month, category)
Upserts summaries (increments total_credits, action_count if month row exists)
Deletes all credit_logs WHERE created_at < NOW() - INTERVAL '45 days'
Returns count of purged rows and summaries written
Also purges expired price_snapshots (past expires_at)
Deployed with --no-verify-jwt (internal cron call). Validates X-Cron-Secret header.

stories.title: Add credit usage query tool to Copilot (NL queries on credit_logs)
acceptance: New edge function get-credit-usage-summary(user_id, org_id, query_type) returns structured usage data
query_type options: today | this_week | last_30_days | by_category | burn_rate | top_meetings
burn_rate: rolling 7-day average daily spend, projected depletion date
copilot-autonomous gets a new tool definition: query_credit_usage({ query_type, filters })
Copilot responds conversationally with the data (not raw JSON)
Handles: 'how many credits today', 'biggest expense', 'how long will credits last', 'show usage this week', 'which meetings cost most'

stories.title: Add proactive spend alert triggers to Copilot
acceptance: check_credit_alerts(org_id, user_id) function evaluates 6 alert conditions: balance<20%, balance<10cr, negative balance, budget cap hit, weekly digest ready, tier upgrade suggestion
Returns array of pending alerts (alert_type, message, data)
copilot-autonomous checks pending alerts at session start and surfaces relevant one as a proactive message
Alert deduplication: each alert type stored with last_alerted_at, won't re-alert within 24h (balance/cap) or 7d (weekly digest)
credit_alert_log table: user_id, alert_type, alerted_at, data JSONB — prevents repeat spamming
Tier upgrade suggestion: compares last 7d high-tier cost vs estimated medium-tier cost. Only suggests if saving >20%.

parallelGroups.name: Schema Foundation
parallelGroups.description: Independent migrations — run in parallel. CTRAK-001 already complete.

parallelGroups.name: Backend APIs + Grace Threshold
parallelGroups.description: All depend on schema but are independent of each other

parallelGroups.name: Grace Threshold + Budget Caps Schema
parallelGroups.description: Independent schema additions, run in parallel

parallelGroups.name: Budget Cap Wiring
parallelGroups.description: Depends on both CTRAK-006 and CTRAK-007

parallelGroups.name: Frontend + Retention
parallelGroups.description: Admin UI, user menu page, and purge job can all run in parallel

parallelGroups.name: Copilot Intelligence
parallelGroups.description: NL query tool — needs credit_logs populated
